alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 21 at 9:36PM MDT until October 23 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches with locally higher amounts up to 10 inches over the higher peaks. * WHERE...Elevations above 6000 ft across the West Central Mountains and Boise Mountains zones. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, including portions of Idaho Highways 21 and 55 along with Warren Wagon Road north of McCall. * ADDITIONAL IMPACTS...Backcountry enthusiasts and hunters should be prepared for wintry conditions and the potential for hypothermia if caught in a storm unprepared. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulations of 1-2 inches are also expected between 4000-6000 ft through noon MDT Sunday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
